org.restsql.security

Interface Authorizer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AuthorizerImpl

    public interface Authorizer
    Authorizes restSQL requests.
    Author:
    Mark Sawers

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String dumpConfig()
      Returns implementation configuration, e.g.
      boolean isAuthorizationEnabled()
      Returns true if authorization is enabled.
      boolean isAuthorized(SecurityContext context, Request.Type requestType, String sqlResource)
      Checks if user is assigned a role that may perform the request.
      boolean isAuthorized(SecurityContext context, Request request)
      Checks if user is assigned a role that may perform the request.

    • Method Detail

      • isAuthorizationEnabled

        boolean isAuthorizationEnabled()
        Returns true if authorization is enabled.

      • isAuthorized

        boolean isAuthorized(SecurityContext context,
                   Request request)
        Checks if user is assigned a role that may perform the request.
        Parameters:
        context - security context, usually container-provided
        request - SQL Resource request
        Returns:
        true if user is authorized (or authorization is disabled), false otherwise

      • isAuthorized

        boolean isAuthorized(SecurityContext context,
                   Request.Type requestType,
                   String sqlResource)
        Checks if user is assigned a role that may perform the request.
        Parameters:
        context - security context, usually container-provided
        requestType - request type
        sqlResource - SQL resource name
        Returns:
        true if user is authorized (or authorization is disabled), false otherwise

      • dumpConfig

        String dumpConfig()
        Returns implementation configuration, e.g. data store location as well as a string representation of all roles and associated privileges.
